geneSummary: CTNNB1 (β-catenin), a transcriptional activator, is recurrently mutated in various cancers including endometrial and hepatocellular cancers.

mutationEffect.description: The CTNNB1 S37C mutation is located in the N-terminus of the protein. This mutation has been found in liver cancer and craniopharyngioma and is a statistically significant hotspot (PMID: 18358501, 18540944, 26619011). While this mutation has not yet been functionally characterized, endogenous expression of this mutation in an endometrial cancer sample demonstrated increased protein expression compared to samples expressing wildtype (PMID: 9537226).

variantSummary: The CTNNB1 S37C mutation is likely oncogenic.
